alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 17 at 9:40PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Crystal Falls (Michigamme) affecting Iron County. .Recent rain and snowmelt have result in high water along the Michigamme River near Crystal Falls and a Flood Advisory is being issued. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt are occurring. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Crystal Falls (Michigamme). * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, 2700 cfs - River exceeds bankfull stage * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday morning at 1100 AM CDT.
